subject: Re: [junit] Re:How to use JUnit return String[]
msgSnippet: ... Yes, but why duplicate? Extract a method that reveals intent. Vladimir already did it, so let s use it. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Jason Rogers wrote:

> Not to play down Vladimir's JUnit-Addons, but if you want to test arrays
> it is simple enough to do the following given arrays a1 and a2:
>
> assertEquals(Arrays.asList(a1), Arrays.asList(a2));
>
> This will catch a great percentage of the equality tests you need.

Yes, but why duplicate? Extract a method that reveals intent. Vladimir
already did it, so let's use it.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
